titleStmt.title: An Electronic Edition of Mishnah Editio Princeps, Naples 1492
titleStmt.sponsor: Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies
Lieberman Institute; Primary Witnesses to Tannaitic Literature

publicationStmt.pubPlace: The Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities

availability.p: This work is copyright Hayim lapin and the Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies and licensed under a .

note.p: From the Naples First Edition, Published by Joshua Soncino, 1492. Transcription and markup based on images at site.
Transcription and markup by Nurit Ezer; copy-editing and supplements by Leor Jacobi.
Edition includes text of Maimonides' commentary in Hebrew, in second font. This is omitted in transcription.
This transcription does include extensive marginalia, much of it attributable to Samuel Lerma
This document replaces the sample version of BM Ch 2 prepared by Judah Kerbel, Paris.xml

handNote.note: Marginalia (refs to codes) supplied by a hand that appears not to be that of Lerma.

revisionDesc.change: Original transcription (Nurit Ezer) with editing by Leor Jacobi
Markup, with some issues still to be fixed

ab.label: ד
ab.note: The ל in שלש was cancelled; subsequently, the entire word was cancelled and the correction inserted in the margin. Does this suggest more than one corrector, or more than one pass?

ab.label: ב
ab.w: Implicitly, the correction adds a space as well as א.השוחט

ab.label: ו
ab.note: An annotator has corrected מטנחת to מנחת, but the whole word was also deleted and replaced in the margin. Evidence of two annotators, or two passes by the annotator?

ab.label: ו
ab.note: Annotator has overwritten ו as ל, and inserted a ו before the word.
An apparent abbreviation expanded by the annotator.

ab.label: ז
ab.w: אניInsertion of space is implicit in correction.

ab.label: יג
ab.w:
ר ׳
בן Annotator provides the expansion רבן for the abbreviation.

ab.label: ה
ab.w:
ר ׳
בן Annotator provides the expansion רבן for the abbreviation.

ר ׳
בן Annotator provides the expansion רבן for the abbreviation.
